name: Safe Passage
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.

editions.flavor: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.
With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.
As she shepherds the faithful, the angel's radiance is a shield of salvation.
With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.

name: Safewright Quest
text: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Elves search for sources of beauty in a nighted world. Meanwhile, the nighted world searches for the blood of elves.

name: Saffi Eriksdotter
text: Sacrifice Saffi Eriksdotter: When target creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn, return that card to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: In the blink of an eye, she strode from deep snow to dusty waste. From the crease of light behind her, a voice rang hollow: "Saffi, wait for me . . . ."

name: Sage Aven
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: From their mountain aeries, aven scholars see far more than the distant horizon.

name: Sage-Eye Avengers
text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Sage-Eye Avengers attacks, you may return target creature to its owner's hand if its power is less than Sage-Eye Avengers's power.

name: Sage-Eye Harrier
text:
Flying
Morph {3}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: These winged warriors meditate in flight, tracing mandalas in the clouds.

name: Sage of Ancient Lore
text:
Sage of Ancient Lore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
When Sage of Ancient Lore enters the battlefield, draw a card.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Sage of Ancient Lore.

name: Sage of Epityr
text: When Sage of Epityr enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: Clairvoyants across Dominaria were driven mad by the overload from the widening time rifts, while other random folk gained the gift of future sight.

name: Sage of Fables
text:
Each other Wizard creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "There is no secret that cannot be sold."

name: Sage of Hours
text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Sage of Hours, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Remove all +1/+1 counters from Sage of Hours: For each five counters removed this way, take an extra turn after this one.

name: Sage of Lat-Nam
text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Within each device is a spark of its creator's soul. Within each sage is a lamp that awaits that spark.

name: Sage of Shaila's Claim
text: When Sage of Shaila's Claim enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E}{E} (three energy counters).

editions.flavor: Even now, Shaila's descendants proudly occupy the greenway that she refused to relinquish to the Consulate.

name: Sage of the Inward Eye
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "No one petal claims beauty for the lotus."
"No one petal claims beauty for the lotus."
"No one petal claims beauty for the lotus."

name: Sage Owl
text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: The owl asks but never answers.
Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.
The owl asks but never answers.

name: Sage's Dousing
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}. If you control a Wizard, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Curse these merrows and their meddling! Since coming near the river, I can't so much as sneeze without being soaked."
—Ashling the Pilgrim

name: Sage's Knowledge
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching
(trans. Feng and English)

name: Sages of the Anima
text: If you would draw a card, instead reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: Godtrackers found new pantheons of beast-gods beyond Naya's borders.

name: Sage's Reverie
text:
Enchant creature
When Sage's Reverie enters the battlefield, draw a card for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.

name: Sage's Row Denizen
text: Whenever another blue creature enters the battlefield under your control, target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: "I offer you wisdom untainted by false loyalty, learning free of any guild's agenda."

text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: His arrows whistle like a serpent's hiss.

−2: Create a token that's a copy of target artifact or creature you control, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

• Create a token that's a copy of target artifact.
• Create a token that's a copy of target creature, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types.

text: {2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: Clients who cheat the sailmonger make an impact on the rest.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, add {G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

Creatures with flying can't attack you or planeswalkers you control.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 5/5 green Wurm creature token.

editions.flavor: Cantankerous and territorial, sandwurms claim even the skies above their dunes.

name: Sangrite Backlash
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.

editions.flavor:
"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Sangrite Surge
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains double strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Some believe the spiky crystal called sangrite is concentrated dragon's breath. Others think it's crystallized life energy. The clans care only about the power it unleashes when crushed.
